title: Geo GraphQL - Remove edges
description:
Follow up for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/35788#note_375471150

We no longer need the `edges` and can reference `nodes` directly in `ee/app/assets/javascripts/geo_replicable/graphql/replicable_type_query_builder.js`.

We will also need to change anywhere "dot-walking" through `edges` and go straight to `nodes`.

title: Dependency Scanning in Docker-in-Docker mode fails for Java projects
description:
### Summary

The [gemnasium-maven](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven) analyzer fails when used with the Docker-in-Docker orchestrator for Dependency Scanning.

### Further details

When started from the [dependency-scanning](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/dependency-scanning) orchestrator, the `gemnasium-maven` analyzer fails with this error message:

```
/analyzer: line 24: switch_to: command not found
```

This is because the `switch_to` function is defined in `.bashrc`, which for some reason is not loaded when using the DinD orchestrator.

The regression was introduced in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/merge_requests/53 (gemnasium-maven v2.15.0) when adding support for multiple versions of Java.

Quoting [`bash` man page](https://linux.die.net/man/1/bash):
 
```
INVOCATION
       ...

       An interactive shell is one started without non-option arguments and without the -c option whose standard input and error are both connected to terminals (as determined by isatty(3)), or one started with the -i option.  PS1  is
       set and $- includes i if bash is interactive, allowing a shell script or a startup file to test this state.
       ...

       When an interactive shell that is not a login shell is started, bash reads and executes commands from ~/.bashrc, if that file exists.  This may be inhibited by using the --norc option.  The --rcfile file option will force  bash
       to read and execute commands from file instead of ~/.bashrc.
```

The code responsible for [creating](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/common/-/blob/v2.10.3/orchestrator/analyzer.go#L172) and [starting the container](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/common/-/blob/v2.10.3/orchestrator/analyzer.go#L201) is in [orchestrator/analyzer.go](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/common/-/blob/v2.10.3/orchestrator/analyzer.go), in the common library.

### Steps to reproduce

- Create a Java or Scala project using Maven, Gradle or Sbt
- Configure Dependency Scanning, and force `DS_DISABLE_DIND` to false 
- Run a pipeline

### Example Project

- Maven project: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/tests/java-maven/-/jobs/628431986
- Maven multi-modules project: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/tests/java-maven-multimodules/-/jobs/628325952
- Gradle project: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/tests/java-gradle/-/jobs/630486123

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Job fails with:

`/analyzer: line 24: switch_to: command not found`

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Job succeeds 

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's tough to read otherwise.)

```
2020/07/08 06:24:37 Copy project directory to containers
2020/07/08 06:24:37 [bundler-audit] Detect project using plugin
2020/07/08 06:24:37 [bundler-audit] Project not compatible
2020/07/08 06:24:37 [retire.js] Detect project using plugin
2020/07/08 06:24:37 [retire.js] Project not compatible
2020/07/08 06:24:37 [gemnasium] Detect project using plugin
2020/07/08 06:24:37 [gemnasium] Project not compatible
2020/07/08 06:24:37 [gemnasium-maven] Detect project using plugin
2020/07/08 06:24:37 [gemnasium-maven] Project is compatible
2020/07/08 06:24:37 [gemnasium-maven] Downloading analyzer...
.................................................................
2020/07/08 06:25:06 [gemnasium-maven] Starting analyzer...
/analyzer: line 24: switch_to: command not found
2020/07/08 06:25:11 Container exited with non zero status code
```

### Possible fixes

Possible fixes are:
- remove [`.bashrc`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/blob/dcf913c08b12629a9f22a63aa1c5b735e0d8fb24/config/.bashrc), and merge it into the [`analyzer-wrapper`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/blob/dcf913c08b12629a9f22a63aa1c5b735e0d8fb24/analyzer-wrapper) 
- find a way to make `gemnasium-maven` process the `.bashrc` file when started from the DinD orchestrator

We might also revert https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/gemnasium-maven/-/merge_requests/53, or even embrace the fact that users have to migrate to the new no-DinD setup, which is now the default.

@gonzoyumo @NicoleSchwartz I suggest a ~P1 ~S1 for this one.

title: Fix bitbucket server import interaction with :new_import_ui feature flag
description:
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/33097 changed HAML part of bitbucket importer to provide values in new way. This does not play well with `:new_import_ui` flag introduced in !34220

Since our intent is to unify all importers code (and there is follow-up issue on removing legacy parts in #220609, we need to align bitbucket_server_controller logic to rely solely on `repo_id` property when determining source for import project (like all our importers do)

/cc @dennis @hdelalic

title: Package Registry - Expand the filter and sort functionality on the Package Registry list view
description:
<!-- The first four sections: "Problem to solve", "Intended users", "User experience goal", and "Proposal", are strongly recommended, while the rest of the sections can be filled out during the problem validation or breakdown phase. However, keep in mind that providing complete and relevant information early helps our product team validate the problem and start working on a solution. -->

### Problem to solve

Some users will have package registries that contain a large variety and quantity of packages. The current sort and filter capabilities may not fulfill the need of easily finding a specific package in a large registry, especially at a group level view.

### Intended users

* [Delaney (Development Team Lead)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#delaney-development-team-lead)
* [Sasha (Software Developer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer)
* [Devon (DevOps Engineer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#devon-devops-engineer)
* [Sidney (Systems Administrator)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sidney-systems-administrator)
* [Sam (Security Analyst)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sam-security-analyst)

### User experience goal

Ensure users are able to find a specific package within a vast list easily.


### Proposal

Remove the tabs in the current UI and create a larger-scale robust filter and search fields. This should enable users to filter by both package format (npm, maven, etc) and the same functionality it currently has with a plane text search.

|Design |
|---|
|![Package_Registry_Group_View](/uploads/410454707400ba815753c791415e20bb/Package_Registry_Group_View.png) |

title: Follow-up from "Reorder snippets in lists using `updated_at` column"
description:
This is a follow up from https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/34393#note_375185273.

Now that we can sort snippets by several criteria, there is a worst-case scenario that should be addressed.

As @iroussos pointed out, when the snippets finder does not search by author nor project, we perform a wide range search using 3 unions. The query is something like:

```sql
SELECT “snippets”.* 
FROM 
(
  (
   SELECT “snippets”.* 
   FROM “snippets” 
   WHERE (“snippets”.“visibility_level” IN (0, 10, 20) OR “snippets”.“author_id” = 5249152) AND “snippets”.“project_id” IS NULL
  )
  UNION
  (
   SELECT “snippets”.* 
   FROM “snippets” 
     INNER JOIN “projects” ON “projects”.“id” = “snippets”.“project_id” 
     INNER JOIN “project_features” ON “project_features”.“project_id” = “projects”.“id” 
   WHERE (“snippets”.“visibility_level” IN (0, 10, 20) OR “snippets”.“author_id” = 5249152) 
     AND (projects.visibility_level IN (0,10,20)) 
     AND “project_features”.“snippets_access_level” IN (20, 30)
  )
  UNION
  (
   SELECT “snippets”.* 
   FROM “snippets” 
     INNER JOIN “projects” ON “projects”.“id” = “snippets”.“project_id” 
     INNER JOIN “project_features” ON “project_features”.“project_id” = “projects”.“id” 
   WHERE “project_features”.“snippets_access_level” IN (20, 30, 10) 
     AND (EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM “project_authorizations” WHERE (project_id = snippets.project_id) AND “project_authorizations”.“user_id” = 5249152))
  )
) snippets 
ORDER BY “snippets”.“updated_at” DESC
LIMIT 20
```

Without the `ORDER BY`, this query execution times is around 2.5-3 seconds ([query plan](https://explain.depesz.com/s/Gfbn)). Nevertheless, when we introduce the `ORDER BY` the query execution time is increased a lot (7.363 s | [query plan](https://explain.depesz.com/s/CTW2)).

With a small rewrite of the query, we can reduce this time to 2.581 s ([query plan](https://explain.depesz.com/s/Ve2D)):

```sql
SELECT “snippets”.*
FROM “snippets” 
WHERE id IN
(
  (
   SELECT “snippets”.id
   FROM “snippets” 
   WHERE (“snippets”.“visibility_level” IN (0, 10, 20) OR “snippets”.“author_id” = 5249152) AND “snippets”.“project_id” IS NULL
  )
  UNION
  (
   SELECT “snippets”.id
   FROM “snippets” 
     INNER JOIN “projects” ON “projects”.“id” = “snippets”.“project_id” 
     INNER JOIN “project_features” ON “project_features”.“project_id” = “projects”.“id” 
   WHERE (“snippets”.“visibility_level” IN (0, 10, 20) OR “snippets”.“author_id” = 5249152) 
     AND (projects.visibility_level IN (0,10,20)) 
     AND “project_features”.“snippets_access_level” IN (20, 30)
  )
  UNION
  (
   SELECT “snippets”.id
   FROM “snippets” 
     INNER JOIN “projects” ON “projects”.“id” = “snippets”.“project_id” 
     INNER JOIN “project_features” ON “project_features”.“project_id” = “projects”.“id” 
   WHERE “project_features”.“snippets_access_level” IN (20, 30, 10) 
     AND (EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM “project_authorizations” WHERE (project_id = snippets.project_id) AND “project_authorizations”.“user_id” = 5249152))
  )
)  
ORDER BY “snippets”.“updated_at” DESC
LIMIT 20
```

The change also works for the case when the `ORDER BY` is not set, where we can reduce the execution time to 1.5s ([query plan](https://explain.depesz.com/s/5ugu))

We are also changing another query that is present in the `SnippetFinder` EE extension:

```sql
explain SELECT “snippets”.*
FROM (
        (SELECT “snippets”.*
         FROM “snippets”
         WHERE “snippets”.“author_id” = 5249152
           AND “snippets”.“project_id” IS NULL)
      UNION
        (SELECT “snippets”.*
         FROM “snippets”
         INNER JOIN “projects” ON “projects”.“id” = “snippets”.“project_id”
         INNER JOIN “project_features” ON “project_features”.“project_id” = “projects”.“id”
         WHERE “project_features”.“snippets_access_level” IN (20,
                                                              30,
                                                              10)
           AND (EXISTS
                  (SELECT 1
                   FROM “project_authorizations”
                   WHERE (project_id = snippets.project_id)
                     AND “project_authorizations”.“user_id” = 5249152)))) snippets
```

The execution time is quite fast, around 447ms ([query plan](https://explain.depesz.com/s/9fMv)). When we introduce a sorting criteria the execution time is very similar 494ms ([query plan](https://explain.depesz.com/s/6ovt)).

If we apply the same optimization, the query would be something like:

```sql
SELECT “snippets”.*
FROM “snippets”
WHERE “snippets”.“id” IN
    (SELECT “snippets”.“id”
     FROM (
             (SELECT “snippets”.“id”
              FROM “snippets”
              WHERE “snippets”.“author_id” = 5249152
                AND “snippets”.“project_id” IS NULL)
           UNION
             (SELECT “snippets”.“id”
              FROM “snippets”
              INNER JOIN “projects” ON “projects”.“id” = “snippets”.“project_id”
              INNER JOIN “project_features” ON “project_features”.“project_id” = “projects”.“id”
              WHERE “project_features”.“snippets_access_level” IN (20,
                                                                   30,
                                                                   10)
                AND (EXISTS
                       (SELECT 1
                        FROM “project_authorizations”
                        WHERE (project_id = snippets.project_id)
                          AND “project_authorizations”.“user_id” = 5249152)))) snippets)
```

The execution time now is 48ms ([query plan](https://explain.depesz.com/s/k3UV)) and with a sort criteria the time is 46ms ([query plan](https://explain.depesz.com/s/nsh1).

title: Display 'Resolved' notification on Security Dashboards (FE implementation issue)
description:
See [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/207183) and parent Epic for details.

NOTE: this has been triaged by @svedova as part of https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/207183#note_348853725

## Implementation Plan
(from https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/207183#implementation-checklist - please update) 
* [ ] ~frontend Display notification when a vulnerability has all findings resolved but is still in a `detected` state. For reference, here is the short term fix: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/227113. It adds a `resolvedOnDefaultBranch` property for the `vulnerability.fragment.graphql`. We need to read this value and display a badge. See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/35860#badge-detail for the designs.

title: New user onboarding remove banner and footer links from onboarding step
description:
## Problem
Currently, the user can easily get distracted in this onboarding step by the banner and footer links. 
 
![Screen_Shot_2020-07-07_at_3.30.29_PM](/uploads/1554d792908b759a6eca18065a78dd71/Screen_Shot_2020-07-07_at_3.30.29_PM.png)
 
## Solution
We should remove the confirm email banner from this page and remove the footer CTAs (`help` `about GitLab`).

---

<details>
<summary>:tools: :notepad_spiral: Developer Notes</summary>

## Notes

- As far as I can tell, this is not an experiment, but is part of the existing, but currently disabled, Onboarding Issue Board experiment
- There are no events to track
- We want to postpone the “please check your email” banner
  - Potentially problematic or difficult
- We want to hide the “Help” & “About GitLab” footer links
  - Potentially quite easy
- Notification banner message code path
  - `app/controllers/concerns/confirm_email_warning.rb => set_confirm_warning`
  - `app/controllers/application_controller.rb => include ConfirmEmailWarning`
  - `app/views/layouts/_flash.html.haml => flash.each {|key, value| %span= value }`
  - _**was**_ `app/views/layouts/devise_experimental_separate_sign_up_flow.html.haml => render "layouts/flash"`
    - _**is now**_ `app/views/layouts/devise_experimental_onboarding_issues.html.haml => render "layouts/flash"`
  - _**was**_ `app/controllers/registrations/experience_levels_controller.rb => layout => 'devise_experimental_separate_sign_up_flow'`
    - _**is now**_ `app/controllers/registrations/experience_levels_controller.rb => layout => 'devise_experimental_onboarding_isues'`
  - `app/controllers/registrations/experience_levels_controller.rb => #show action`
- Footer links code path
  - _**was**_ `app/views/layouts/devise_experimental_separate_sign_up_flow.html.haml => .footer-links`
    - _**is now**_ `app/views/layouts/devise_experimental_onboarding_issues.html.haml => .footer-links`

## Questions

- :white_check_mark: How do we postpone the notification banner?
  - We can just not show it – the concern which is included in `ApplicationController` will keep popping it up wherever we go in the app
- :white_check_mark: Where does this banner get created?
  - in the `ConfirmEmailWarning` concern which is included in `ApplicationController`
  - it appears that it will always show this notice so long as the feature is enabled & the user is not confirmed
- How is this banner rendered?
- Are there other banners that might pop up as well?

## Assumptions

- The notification banners show up because of a flash rendering block in the layout
  - Perhaps we can just remove that block (create our own layout or use another one) to avoid showing those?
- :white_check_mark: The notification banners are created using flash messaging
  - In which case, they can’t be delayed, they always appear on the next page load, right?
  - Or do they only disappear after we successfully access them from that same flash hash?

## Next Steps

1. Research the notification banners (see questions & assumptions above)
1. Research the footer links (just to make sure my assumption isn’t way off base)
1. Consider, briefly, creating some mechanism for delaying flash messages (if it doesn’t already exist – look for existing gems, too)
1. Update the layout (duplicate & modify, find a new one, or potentially modify this one directly) to not show flash messages and to not show the footer links
1. Submit 1 MR for hiding the footer links, 1 MR for hiding the flash messages, (any other MRs for delaying flash messages until later)
</details>

epic.title: New user onboarding relaunch

title: Create an event that fires during the group creation process
description:
## Problem
 
If a user enters a common name for their group they get a message that the URL is already taken which reduces the likelihood that they will be able to successfully sign up for GitLab. 
 
![Screen_Shot_2020-07-07_at_3.29.30_PM](/uploads/a948e7abde2929151ec260caeb21ad97/Screen_Shot_2020-07-07_at_3.29.30_PM.png)
 
## Solution
 
MVC update to resolve this issue: 
 
* three tracked events:
   * successful submission (on first try)
   * error: URL path is already taken (each time they attempt to submit the form and it errors)
   * successful submission (after getting an error re: path already taken)

If a user encounters the error multiple times then we want to capture that i.e. events would be captured in the following scenario: 
1. (arrived at form)
2. submission with error (URL path is already taken)
3. submission with error (URL path is already taken)
4. submission with error (URL path is already taken)
5. successful submission after error
 
We will analyze the results of these events to understand if we should invest further engineering effort into improving the response time it take for the error to appear if a group URL is already taken.

title: Move `Gitlab::CurrentSettings.default_branch_name` check to HasRepository
description:
We have at least 2 places in the app where we fetch the /idea/ of "default branch name" directly.

```ruby
`Gitlab::CurrentSettings.default_branch_name` || "master"
```

Iteratively this made sense, but once a project is populated with it's own content and branches, it responds to `#default_branch` (https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/models/concerns/has_repository.rb#L78-80).  Instead of returning `nil`, should it instead return `Gitlab::CurrentSettings.default_branch_name`?

Related to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/221013

title: Allow admins to list PAT tokens via REST API
description:
### Problem solve

In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/36742 we implemented a [credentials inventory](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/admin_area/credentials_inventory.html) to enable `administrators` to list user access credentials, including Personal Access Token (PAT) records.

An HTML UI does not sufficiently support larger organizations that rely on GitLab's APIs to programmatically carry out many functions within the application.

### Further details

Although GitLab is ["GraphQL first"](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/#sts=GraphQL%20first), this feature is expected to be used in conjunction with the [REST API for ApplicationSetting](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/settings.html) and should be implemented in the REST API on that basis.

### Intended users

* [Sidney (Systems Administrator)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sidney-systems-administrator)
* [Cameron (Compliance Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#cameron-compliance-manager)

### Proposal

Add a REST endpoint that allows an `administrator` to list all user Personal Access Token (PAT) records.

title: DAST Site profile - Form MVC - Add delete capability
description:
## Summary

This issue is for adding delete capability to the **DAST Site profile** form. This action is available when editing an existing site profile.

## Designs

* Figma file: https://www.figma.com/file/7CaJqOTOpPEOzkYkoU5bs5/DAST-Ondemand-Profile

## Implementation plan

- [ ] Add the **Delete profile** button to the **DAST Site profile** form.
- [ ] Clicking on the button triggers a GraphQL mutation[1] for deleting the profile.
- [ ] On success, redirect back to the landing page.

[1] GraphQL mutation

The GraphQL mutation should already exist at this point as it will be added as part of the **DAST Site profiles library** MVC. Its structure is being discussed here: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/225816#note_373081653

title: DAST Site profile - Form MVC - Add edit capability - Frontend
description:
- ~backend counterpart: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/227252

## Summary

This issue is for adding edit capability to the **DAST Site profile** form. At this point, the form should already have been created and should be able to create new DAST Site profiles. We now want to make it possible to edit existing profiles.

## Designs

* Figma file: https://www.figma.com/file/7CaJqOTOpPEOzkYkoU5bs5/DAST-Ondemand-Profile

## Implementation plan

- [x] Adapt the ~backend to make the edit page accessible.
    - [x] Add the edit route to `ee/config/routes/project.rb`.
    - [x] Add the edit action to the controller (`ee/app/controllers/projects/dast_site_profiles_controller.rb`).
    - [x] The edit action should retrieve the profile's data so that it can be passed down to the Vue app down the line.
    - [x] Create/update `ee/app/views/projects/profiles/site_profiles/edit.html.haml` so that the HAML passes the profile's data down to the Vue app.
- [x] The Vue app populates the fields with the data provided by the HAML.
- [x] Submitting the form triggers a [GraphQL mutation](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/3772#update-a-dast-site-profile) for updating the profile in the DB.
- [x] When the mutation succeeds, redirect back to the profiles page.
- [-] ~~Add a link to the edit form from the library.~~ https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/233401

title: DAST Site profiles - Form MVC - Add routes
description:
## Summary

This issue covers the creation of the basic routes and views that will be required to implement the **DAST Site profiles** feature. We'll need an `index` view to access the profiles library and a `new` view to create a DAST Site profile. Those views should be accessible at the following URLs:

- `index`: `/:namespace/:project/-/on_demand_scans/profiles`
- `new`: `/:namespace/:project/-/on_demand_scans/profiles/dast_site_profiles/new`

## Implementation plan

- [x] Update `ee/config/routes/project.rb` to include the new routes
- [x] Define the new controller actions
- [x] Create the corresponding HAML views
- [x] The new routes should be protected with the same permissions as the current `/:namespace/:project/-/on_demand_scans` route

title: Update CrowdIn commit messages to pass Danger review
description:
### Problem

Currently our CrowdIn integration creates commits with messages of this structure https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/commit/769639d4446d61ad27731de41ff531682102f1bd:
```
commit 769639d4446d61ad27731de41ff531682102f1bd
Author: GitLab Crowdin Bot <douwe+crowdinbot@gitlab.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 2 01:28:29 2020 +0000

    New translations gitlab.pot (Igbo)
    [skip ci]
```

As a result Dangerbot fails with the following error for every commit:
```
- [ ] 769639d4446d61ad27731de41ff531682102f1bd: The commit subject and body must be separated by a blank line. For more information, take a look at our [Commit message guidelines](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/contributing/merge_request_workflow.html#commit-messages-guidelines).
```
This can be seen here: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/jobs/620433335

This causes in a lot of noise on the merge request where we are trying to find actual failures with the translations. We're currently working around this by squashing all the commits into one, and fixing the message on that one commit.

### Goal

To update the commit message coming from CrowdIn so that it matches the requirements to pass Dangerbot. We have a configuration file for this here: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/crowdin.yml

epic.title: Technical internationalization improvements

title: Investigate how to run automated translation process
description:
As part of https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/19896 we want to be able to execute actions on the GitLab repo in order to import our translations from CrowdIn.

This includes actions such as:
1. Making an API request to the CrowdIn API based on the results of an MR pipeline
1. Updating commits/triggering a pipeline for the merge requests created by @gitlab-crowdin-bot 
1. Adding comments to the merge request so we can trace the actions

### Goal
To find out what infrastructure we need to be able to run all of these actions on the GitLab repo - either as a user triggering the start of the process or a scheduled job.

The outcome of this should be a plan and an estimate of effort on how to get this set up.

epic.title: Technical internationalization improvements

title: Add dangerbot to secure analyzer projects
description:
In order to ensure proper labeling, good commit hygiene, and consistency for engineers at GitLab, we should add Dangerbot to the `gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers` projects with rules that are consistent with GitLab's main repository. 

Because the analyzers do not have the same development processes as GitLab's main repository, not all the repository rules will be used.

DAST recently implemented this with https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/207535 and I'd suggest we start out with matching rulesets to those, [as demonstrated by the relevant MR](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/dast/-/merge_requests/129/diffs)

title: NoMethodError when trying to unsubscribe from design
description:
## Summary

https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlabcom/issues/1675520/?referrer=gitlab_plugin

```
NoMethodError: undefined method `unsubscribe' for #<DesignManagement::Design:0x00007fbf0ffc5d48>
(139 additional frame(s) were not displayed)
...
  abstract_controller/base.rb:195:in `process_action'
    send_action(method_name, *args)
  action_controller/metal/basic_implicit_render.rb:6:in `send_action'
    super.tap { default_render unless performed? }
  sent_notifications_controller.rb:11:in `unsubscribe'
    return unsubscribe_and_redirect if current_user || params[:force]
  sent_notifications_controller.rb:27:in `unsubscribe_and_redirect'
    noteable.unsubscribe(@sent_notification.recipient, @sent_notification.project)
  active_model/attribute_methods.rb:432:in `method_missing'
    match ? attribute_missing(match, *args, &block) : super

NoMethodError: undefined method `unsubscribe' for #<DesignManagement::Design:0x00007fbf0ffc5d48>
```

## Proposal

~~Detect if the design doesn't exist and abort with a 404 response.~~ Possibly https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/227176#note_378755685?


## Backlog Refinement by @alexkalderimis:

**Documentation needed:**

If we are aiming just to avoid this failure, then yes, as @.luke mentions, we
will need to document the limitation.

If we want to actually make this unsubscribable, then probably also yes, or at
least to link existing documentation to design management index.

**Test Activity Planned:**

Option 1: Removing unsubscribe interface

- Feature: test that unsubscribe is not presented to user
- Unit (Views): test that unsubscribe interface is not generated

Option 2: enable subscribe/unsubscribe functionality (see #228755)

- Unit: Test for `Subscribable` methods
- Integration: Test for `SentNotification` compatibility
- Feature: Test subscribing and unsubscribing to design

**Security Tests Planned:** 

Option 1: Removing unsubscribe interface

None

Option 2: enable subscribe/unsubscribe functionality (see #228755)

These need to be aligned with other subscription models, but should be tested as
part of the unit tests. Since any user who can `:read_design` should be able to
subscribe, this is likely not onerous.

**Explanation for Approach to be taken:**

Option 1: Removing unsubscribe interface

In views, detect if the model cannot handle subscription, and remove any UI
elements that should not be shown.

Option 2: enable subscribe/unsubscribe functionality (see #228755)

Include `Subscribable` in `DesignManagement::Design`, add explicit support in
`SentNotifications` (I actually think this could stand being redesigned so that
it does not have any type predicates).

**MR Breakdown:**

Option 1: Removing unsubscribe interface

1 MR to remove unnecessary interface.

Option 2: enable subscribe/unsubscribe functionality (see #228755)

Probably 2

- Update `Design` to include `Subscribable`
- Update services and notifications to test compatibility
 
**Weight Estimate:**

Option 1: Removing unsubscribe interface

1

Option 2: enable subscribe/unsubscribe functionality (see #228755)

2-3

---

## Backlog Refinement by @.Luke:

**Documentation needed:** Y - possibly could be documented as a limitation

**Test Activity Planned:**  Unit tests 

**Security Tests Planned:**  n/a

**Explanation for Approach to be taken:**  Sizing based on https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/227176#note_378755685. Add designs to the list of models that are unsubscribable.

**MR Breakdown:**

*  1 MR
 
**Weight Estimate:**  1

---
## Backlog Refinement by @toupeira:

**Documentation needed:**  N

**Test Activity Planned:**  Test `SentNotificationsController#unsubscribe` with a `reply_key` pointing to a `DesignManagement::Design`


**Security Tests Planned:**  n/a


**Explanation for Approach to be taken:**  As explained by Luke below.


**MR Breakdown:** 1 MR


**Weight Estimate:**  1

---

title: CarrierWave::IntegrityError when uploading designs with unsupported file formats
description:
## Summary

See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/227175#note_378761858. 

The exception is handled and is being sent to Sentry https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/227175#note_380255217.

https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitlabcom/issues/1647620/?referrer=gitlab_plugin

```
CarrierWave::IntegrityError: file format is not supported. Please try one of the following supported formats: image/png, image/jpeg, image/bmp, image/gif
(92 additional frame(s) were not displayed)
...
  carrierwave/uploader/cache.rb:137:in `cache!'
    with_callbacks(:cache, @file) do
  carrierwave/uploader/callbacks.rb:14:in `with_callbacks'
    self.class._before_callbacks[kind].each { |c| send c, *args }
  carrierwave/uploader/callbacks.rb:14:in `each'
    self.class._before_callbacks[kind].each { |c| send c, *args }
  carrierwave/uploader/callbacks.rb:14:in `block in with_callbacks'
    self.class._before_callbacks[kind].each { |c| send c, *args }
  content_type_whitelist.rb:34:in `check_content_type_whitelist!'
    raise CarrierWave::IntegrityError, message

CarrierWave::IntegrityError: file format is not supported. Please try one of the following supported formats: image/png, image/jpeg, image/bmp, image/gif
```

## Proposal

We should catch this error at the API layer and return an appropriate response.



## Backlog Refinement by @alexkalderimis:

**Documentation needed:**

None needed. We already document the kinds of files we support.

**Test Activity Planned:**

~GraphQL request tests for handling illegal file-types.

Add tests in the `NewVersionWorker` for similar scenarios.

**Security Tests Planned:**

This test is essentially entirely about security.

**Explanation for Approach to be taken:**

Either we just add tests for this scenario and encode the current behavior as
defined behavior, or we aim to capture this error and report to the user.

Currently this does not cause errors during version creation, where we should
catch it, but during image processing in the `NewVersionWorker`. If we capture
this state in version creation, then we can avoid needed changes to
`NewVersionWorker`, but if the range of types is not co-incident, then we may
need changes to both.

This is somewhat odd, since we currently _do_ check the mimetype of the file
during the `NewVersionWorker` before processing (see
`design_management/generate_image_versions_service.rb#L49` in
`#generate_image`), so this is either a case of a mismatch between the values of
`DesignManagement::DesignV432x230Uploader::MIME_TYPE_WHITELIST` and the logic of
`#content_type_whitelist.rb#L34` in `check_content_type_whitelist!` or something
subtler, such as the content not matching the declared mimetype.

Since this is a very low incidence event, and encountered during offline
processing, tolerating some level of failure is likely acceptable.

**MR Breakdown:**

A single MR, if needed.

**Weight Estimate:**

2 to eliminate the error, otherwise 1 to tolerate it (possibly with test).

---

## Backlog Refinement by @.Luke:

**Documentation needed:**  N

**Test Activity Planned:** Change the test of `GenerateImageVersionsService` to test for logging

**Security Tests Planned:** N

**Explanation for Approach to be taken:**  Switch to logging the error https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/227175#note_381333333

**MR Breakdown:** 1 MR

**Weight Estimate:** 1

---
## Backlog Refinement by @toupeira:

**Documentation needed:**  N

**Test Activity Planned:**  Test the worker with an invalid file.

**Security Tests Planned:**  n/a

**Explanation for Approach to be taken:**  This is an expected error, so I think we just need to catch it to avoid the worker retrying multiple times.

**MR Breakdown:** 1 MR

**Weight Estimate:**  1

---

title: Multi-line comment select shows extra options after switching to parallel mode
description:
### Summary

Follow-up from https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/33655#note_372548297.

In merge request changes, after switching from inline to parallel mode (without reloading the page), the multi-line comment select shows extra options. This happens, for example, if a long file had all of its contents replaced by just a few lines.

In the example below, the select shows the removed lines as well. This is the correct behavior for **inline** mode but not for **parallel**. If the page is reloaded, the select shows the correct options.

| Incorrect: After switching from inline to parallel | Correct: In parallel after page reload |
|---|---|
| ![image](/uploads/35dcee36a7da80384ba1be241375a2ff/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/320725e669971a681b0a9856e86d9732/image.png) |

epic.title: 💬 Comment on multiple lines in a merge request diff

title: DAST: Bring back command-line option -c and DAST_ZAP_CONFIG_FILE
description:
The decision was [made](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/dast/-/merge_requests/185) to remove the DAST command-line option `-c` and the accompanying environment variable `DAST_ZAP_CONFIG_FILE`. Removing this functionality is a breaking change, but unfortunately, no feature deprecation process was followed. 

Removing this functionality broke the DAST full scan that we [use internally](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-security/engineering/-/issues/959). We invested a lot of time to set up this scan and request the removal of `-c` to be reverted.

For the record: Per https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/dast/-/merge_requests/185#note_361568169, @sethgitlab found that `-c` is not working. This does not match with our experience from https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-security/engineering/-/issues/959, where we found `-c` to work as intended.

Labeling this as ~bug because existing functionality was broken.

@gitlab-org/secure/dynamic-analysis-be 

cc @estrike @jritchey @ngeorge1

title: Remove performance_bar JS from main.js
description:
Currently we load the JS for the performance_bar through main.js which is not necessary as most users have most probably no performance bar so we should simply load in its own bundle and only if the performance bar is activated.

Main.JS Line: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/main.js#L166

How the CSS is loaded when activated: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/app/views/layouts/_head.html.haml#L57

epic.title: Optimize main.js Bundle structure

title: Show CODEOWNERS section names in MR form
description:
Follow-up from "Add section names to code owners approvals list" https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/33259#note_372393159.

Currently, the CODEOWNERS section names are not visible in the MR edit form. https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/215050 shows the CODEOWNERS section names only in the **MR approvals widget**.

We display CODEOWNER approval rules in the MR form (but only when editing) — **if the target branch matches a protected branch rule and has the `Code owner approval` setting enabled**.

![image](/uploads/97307c5534c91be7a63dba18daf7dc24/image.png)

We also need to add the section names here.

epic.title: Sectional CODEOWNERS

title: Clear memoized issue min and max id in usage data
description:
Follow-up of https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/35298/

We added optimization for issues with health counter using memoized min and max id. We should clear memoized values to ensure we get fresh values each time usage data is calculated

title: Release yaml node :ref should allow branches or tags
description:
### Summary The release yaml node `ref` should allow using branches or existing tags. Per the [Releases API](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/releases/#create-a-release) documentation > It can be a commit SHA, another tag name, or a branch name. With https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/34943 the `ref` is validated via [`Commit.reference_valid?`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/34943/diffs#b416173235cdd1c251dee967e296a53b13399d24_34_48). This validation fails for branches or tags. ### Steps to reproduce Requires `Feature.enable!(:ci_release_generation)` Use a branch name as reference as ref in the release yaml configuration ```yaml release: ref: 'master' ``` The pipeline will return an error because red is not a valid reference ```plaintext 'release ref must be a valid ref' ``` ### Example Project For this [.gitlab-ci.yml](https://dev.gitlab.org/jaime/hello/-/blob/master/.gitlab-ci.yml) file with pipeline https://dev.gitlab.org/jaime/hello/-/pipelines/160659 ### What is the current *bug* behavior? When using a non-commit SHA as ref the pipeline does not run ```plaintext 'release ref must be a valid ref' ``` ### What is the expected *correct* behavior? The pipeline should run if the ref is a commit SHA, a tag or a branch name ### Relevant logs and/or screenshots ![Screen_Shot_2020-07-07_at_2.09.48_pm](/uploads/dbb503db4195ec3a222c5fb75cdaedef/Screen_Shot_2020-07-07_at_2.09.48_pm.png) ### Output of checks #### Results of GitLab environment info
Expand for output related to GitLab environment info 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:env:info`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:env:info RAILS_ENV=production`)
#### Results of GitLab application Check
Expand for output related to the GitLab application check 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:check SANITIZE=true`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:check RAILS_ENV=production SANITIZE=true`)

(we will only investigate if the tests are passing)
### Possible fixes Remove this validation `Commit.reference_valid?` and let the API decide wether the release can be created from the ref or not.

title: Proper fix for vulnerability resolution
description:
See [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/207183) and parent Epic for details.

## Implementation Plan

Each of these tasks can be a separate MR:

~~- [ ] Extend GraphQL `VulnerabilityType` to return `resolved_on_default_branch`~~ (should be resolved in scope of #227113)
- [x] ~backend Create a `resolved_on_default_branch` column in the `vulnerabilities` table and set that value from the pipeline. We would probably need to default to `nil` to indicate the check has not been run yet. With this change, we would check the database value first, then calculate using the existing method.
- [x] ~backend Remove a method `resolved_on_default_branch` from `Vulnerability` model
- [x] ~backend Prepare a background migration to set the value as needed (you could use https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/lib/gitlab/database/migrations/background_migration_helpers.rb#L58).
- [x] ~backend Extend `Security::StoreReportService` with logic that calculates if Vulnerability is `resolved_on_default_branch`: simply take all vulnerabilities that are not found in report occurrences and set `resolved_on_default_branch` to true; remember about setting `resolved_on_default_branch` to false if vulnerability is rediscovered. `Security::StoreReportService` is used only in `Security::StoreReportsService`, which is only used in `StoreSecurityReportsWorker` which is scheduled in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/ee/app/models/ee/ci/pipeline.rb#L60 only if pipeline is running on the default branch.

epic.title: Resolved Vulnerability Notification

title: Short-term fix for vulnerability resolution
description:
See [Design Issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/207183) and parent Epic for details.

## Implementation Plan

- [ ] Use current N+1 `resolved_on_default_branch` method in `ee/app/models/vulnerability.rb` as a short term solution. This result will be sent in the response to the UI. It's slow, but it will start giving us some correct data.
  - [ ] ~backend Extend `Types::VulnerabilityType` with new field `resolved_on_default_branch` and update specs
  - [ ] ~backend/~frontend Make sure front-end code is properly reading that value from GraphQL (add `resolvedOnDefaultBranch` to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/vulnerabilities/graphql/vulnerability.fragment.graphql and make sure that https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/vulnerabilities/components/vulnerability_list.vue#L282) is presented properly.

epic.title: Resolved Vulnerability Notification

title: Improve responsiveness style for activities bar
description: The current setting of the activities bar on the home page is currently set to `overflow: hidden`. So whenever the screen shrinks, all the menu items are just hidden away and not accessible. And when it gets to mobile size, it's completely hidden. Here's a video: ![activities-home-page-overflow-hidden-gl](/uploads/08db8fbb62627d84ef2782dbc6e5a697/activities-home-page-overflow-hidden-gl.mp4) ## Improvement thoughts **Question** Maybe we can improve the UX experience. So the menu items are wrapped or designed in a way that all the menu items will always be displayed regardless of size? :thinking:

description:

Been trying to define `AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY` variable to use it for configuring terraform backend to consume a s3-compatible service, the value from the provider is an uuid-based token which goes against current expected pattern in gitlab.com

Try to set an arbitrary value for variable AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY in repository settings.

Arbitrary value goes against current expected pattern in gitlab.com

Accept arbitrary value

This bug happens on GitLab.com

title: Long vulnerability identifiers are not wrapped correctly in the Pipeline Security tab
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

(Summarize the bug encountered concisely)
Some identifiers can be very long, and in the Pipeline Security tab, they're not wrapped correctly, leading to text overlapping.

### Steps to reproduce

(How one can reproduce the issue - this is very important)
- Run dependency scanning on a vulnerable project
- Make sure you have dependencies caught by the Gemnasium analyzer
- Go to the pipeline once run, and click the Security tab.

### Example Project

(If possible, please create an example project here on GitLab.com that exhibits the problematic behavior, and link to it here in the bug report)

(If you are using an older version of GitLab, this will also determine whether the bug is fixed in a more recent version)

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/tests/js-npm/-/pipelines/163419171/security
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/pipelines/163553040/security

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

- Text overlaps (see screenshot below)

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- Text wrapped correctly.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's tough to read otherwise.)

![Screen_Shot_2020-07-06_at_10.46.12](/uploads/f9a0c6e04df7be957a16d3c35796f2eb/Screen_Shot_2020-07-06_at_10.46.12.png)

(test project, no confidential data here)

### Output of checks

This bug happens on GitLab.com

### Possible fixes

There's some css preventing from wrapping lines correctly:

```css
.table-section {
    white-space: nowrap;
}
```

Once removed, the text appears correctly:

![Screen_Shot_2020-07-06_at_10.56.56](/uploads/cdcb6f84da51fd7d984cc246db2146a0/Screen_Shot_2020-07-06_at_10.56.56.png)

/cc @matt_wilson @thiagocsf @lkerr @andyvolpe

title: Confidential issue titles are exposed
description:
**[HackerOne report #916340](https://hackerone.com/reports/916340)** by `aemirercin` on 2020-07-06, assigned to @cmaxim:

### Summary

When you refer a confidential issue in a commit message and visit the following endpoint, confidential issue title is exposed  in "commit_title_html" field:  
http://host/user/project/-/refs/branch/logs_tree/?format=json&offset=0

### Steps to reproduce


1. Create a public project  
2. Create a confidential issue in this public project  
3. Create a commit in that public project and set commit message to "Solves #<confidential issue id>"   
4. Then open a new browser, access the following URL using a different account that is not a member of the project created in step-1   
http://host/<step-1 user>/<step-1 project>/-/refs/<branch>/logs_tree/?format=json&offset=0  
5. You will see confidential issue title in "commit_title_html" field


### Impact

Confidential issue title is exposed

### Examples

Only tested in my local setup that you can see video below

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Confidential issue title is exposed

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Confidential issue title shouldn't be exposed

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

    > **Suggestion (non-blocking):** WDYT about removing this shared spec here and below? It seems like the date display is already covered by the above spec `'shows the details with no revoked date'`.

The existing structure of the feature tests in `ee/spec/support/shared_examples/features/credentials_inventory_shared_examples.rb` could be better placed as unit tests.

description:

`app/views/admin/projects/show.html.haml`

## Examples

`Project: #{@project.full_name}`

title: Consider running `eslint` "as-if-foss" to catch potential FOSS-specific failures in advance
description:
In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/227004 we can see that `eslint` (and assets compilation) can fail in FOSS when a FOSS file includes a line like `import HealthStatusSelect from 'ee_else_ce/vue_shared/components/sidebar/health_status_select/health_status_bundle';` but when no `app/assets/javascripts/vue_shared/components/sidebar/health_status_select/health_status_bundle` file exists.

I believe we could catch these problems in advance by running `eslint` in a "as-if-foss" fashion.

title: Display performance changes in widget as a percentage (%)
description:
<!-- The first four sections: "Problem to solve", "Intended users", "User experience goal", and "Proposal", are strongly recommended, while the rest of the sections can be filled out during the problem validation or breakdown phase. However, keep in mind that providing complete and relevant information early helps our product team validate the problem and start working on a solution. -->

### Problem to solve

<!-- What problem do we solve? Try to define the who/what/why of the opportunity as a user story. For example, "As a (who), I want (what), so I can (why/value)." -->

Currently in the performance report my project have quite a few benchmarks. However to at a glace determine if there is any relevant degradation is hard. In golang benchmarks output is on the form ns/op, so we end up with 

`ns/op: 2147483647 (+1759776281) in Benchmark1`

Determining how bad this is requires manually counting digits and its one among many benchmarks. 

But even smaller more easy to read benchmarks require some effort. The below numbers are a 2% degradation which is probably within the margin of error but still requires thought to figure out. 

`ns/op: 256 (+5) in Benchmark1`

### Intended users

Anyone for whom performance is important will benefit from increased performance tracking directly or indirectly

* [Simone (Software Engineer in Test)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#simone-software-engineer-in-test)
* [Allison (Application Ops)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#allison-application-ops) 

### User experience goal


### Proposal

* Show performance changes in the performance report as a % as well as the regular numbers.
    * So `ns/op: 2147483647 (+1759776281) in Benchmark1` would become something like `ns/op: 2147483647 (+1759776281) (+453%) in Benchmark1`
    * Where the % is (new score/base score -1)*100.
    * This makes the (very severe) degradation immediately visible.

### Technical Proposal

The browser performance and load performance widgets both use `performance_issue_body.vue` as the component to render issues, so changes we make to that file should be reflected in both widgets. We could duplicate the `issueDelta`/`formatScore` pattern that we already use to display the delta as a number, call the new version `issueDeltaPercentage`/`formatPercentage`, and use it to calculate and display the delta as a percentage of the base score.

We can use one of [these formatters](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/lib/utils/unit_format/index.js#L135-155) to do the locale-specific percentage formatting (i.e. `1,234.56%` vs `1 234,56%`) for the string that goes in the widget.

### Further details

Future iterations: 
* For known sitespeed (for browser performance) or K6 (for load testing) metrics we can be specific with "good"/"bad" delineation about what the change means.
* It might also be nice to be able to define performance degradations as a % but beyond the scope of this proposal



### Permissions and Security

No impact

### Documentation

<!-- See the Feature Change Documentation Workflow https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/workflow.html#for-a-product-change

* Add all known Documentation Requirements in this section. See https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature-change-workflow.html#documentation-requirements
* If this feature requires changing permissions, update the permissions document. See https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/permissions.html -->

### Availability & Testing

<!-- This section needs to be retained and filled in during the workflow planning breakdown phase of this feature proposal, if not earlier.

Minor

### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

<!-- Define both the success metrics and acceptance criteria. Note that success metrics indicate the desired business outcomes, while acceptance criteria indicate when the solution is working correctly. If there is no way to measure success, link to an issue that will implement a way to measure this. -->

### What is the type of buyer?

Same as for the performance report

### Is this a cross-stage feature?

No

title: [Step 4] Update namespace statistics after personal snippet update/removal
description:
At the moment, with all the other issues we've implemented in the related epic, we have introduced the logic to update any update/removal made to a project snippet.

Nevertheless, we need to include in the author's `RootStorageStatistics` any update to personal snippets. For that, we need to rethink all the code we introduced because it doesn't work well with personal snippets.

We're going to replace some of the snippets' logic and use the concern `UpdateProjectStatistics` along with other modifications to include personal snippets changes.

This way, all the logic will be gathered in the `SnippetStatistics` model, and avoid spreading it around in different services.

title: Support custom JSON schema validation in the Web IDE
description:
## Problem to solve

Projects that rely on people writing configurations in JSON or YAML format can cause problems because it's easy to make a typo and break things. It's possible to write validation tools that catch this in the CI pipeline but using a JSON schema file, can be helpful for offering documentation and hints.

## Further details

This is a  problem for the `www-gitlab-com` where we need to write release post items every month.

## Proposal

Users should be able to define custom schema files that are loaded in the Web IDE.

### Implementation Details

The Web IDE has an existing file that's loaded for settings used by the Web Terminal [`.gitlab/.gitlab-webide.yml`](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/web_ide/#file-syncing-to-web-terminal). This should be extended with an additional section `schemas` that allows users to define additional schemas.

```yaml
schemas:
  - uri: https://json.schemastore.org/package
    match: 
      - package.json
  - uri: https://absolute/raw/url
    match: 
      - data/release_posts/unreleased/*.yml
      - data/release_posts/unreleased/*.yaml
  - uri: https://absolute/raw/url2
    match: 
      - data/release_posts/unreleased/*.{yml,yaml}
  - uri: https://absolute/second/raw/url
    match: 
      - "*.gitlab-ci.yml"
```

As an MVC we will only load schema files referenced by absolute URL and not relative path in the repository. This could be the RAW url to a file in the project, a snippet, or something else.

### Pricing Tier

This feature is going to be part of ~"GitLab Premium" in the ~"Enterprise Edition". The rationale for this decision is that teams collaborating on projects where custom schema may be required would benefit from having feedback and mechanisms to use this in the Web IDE.

epic.title: 1st Class Editing Experiences for GitLab features

title: Automatically label MR that changes `/doc` directory with `~documentation` label
description:
### Problem to solve

Relates to: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/technical-writing/-/issues/112.

Any merge request that changes anything in the `doc/` directory can be said to related to ~documentation and should be labelled as such.

We'd like to have Dangerbot do this automatically:

| Condition                                                       | Labels                              |
|:----------------------------------------------------------------|:------------------------------------|
| If **has any changes in `doc/` directory**                      | Then add label ~documentation       |

title: Immediately update repository statistics when running housekeeping and repository cleanup
description:
## Problem to solve

Running reduce repository size or housekeeping does not result in an immediate update of project statistics. Instead I need to wait 10 minutes, 24 hours, some amount of time? Maybe I need to push to trigger an update, and then wait some more? This means it is hard to determine if I have reduced the repository size by force pushing or uploading a commit map. This is a problem if I am approaching my storage limit.

## Further details

## Proposal

When running housekeeping (`Settings >> General >> Advanced >> Housekeeping >> Run Housekeeping`) or repository cleanup (`Settings >> Repository >> Repository cleanup >> Run cleanup`):

1. Update the project statistics immediately to reflect current disk usage
1. Clear the project cache etc so that the repository storage metric is correct when viewing the repository

title: Add a per instance setting to disable the suggest pipeline feature
description:
For some instances, the suggest pipeline banner might not make sense, for example an instance where the projects are mostly issue trackers and may only have a repository to store issue templates and markdown files. In other cases a project owner may decide not to create any pipelines.

Adding an setting at the instance level gives administrators the option of turning off the suggest pipeline feature so that is does not display for any user, in any project.

![Screen_Shot_2020-07-06_at_10.26.05_AM](/uploads/b5b91126a76511ba122133ee9ba831ce/Screen_Shot_2020-07-06_at_10.26.05_AM.png)

## Plan :map: 

### Technical details

1. `suggest_pipeline_enabled` will default to `true` to be backwards-compatible with the current behavior of the application (suggestion banner is shown when MR has no pipelines)

### Implementation tasks

- [x] 1. Add `suggest_pipeline_enabled` setting to application settings: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/70756
- [x] 2. Add new setting to **Admin Area > Settings > CI/CD** page: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/70786
- [x] 3. Update logic to show suggest pipeline banner to check value of `suggest_pipeline_enabled` setting: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/71015

title: Incorrectly encoding json as hex in report output
description:
### Problem

When API Fuzzer generates a report, JSON bodies are incorrectly treated as binary instead of ascii. This makes the output hard for the user to review. This issue will affect any report output.

```http
PUT /api/users/2 HTTP/1.1
Host: target:7777
User-Agent: python-requests/2.24.0
Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate,zlib
Accept: */*
Connection: keep-alive
Authorization: Token b5638ae7-6e77-4585-b035-7d9de2e3f6b3
Content-Length: 59
Via: HTTP/1.1 PeachApiSecurity 0.0.0

00000000   7B 22 75 73 65 72 22 3A  22 64 64 22 2C 22 66 69   {"user":"dd","fi
00000010   72 73 74 22 3A 22 27 22  2C 22 6C 61 73 74 22 3A   rst":"'","last":
00000020   22 73 6D 69 74 68 22 2C  22 70 61 73 73 77 6F 72   "smith","passwor
00000030   64 22 3A 22 68 65 6C 6C  6F 22 7D                  d":"hello"}
```

Example of problem:

 * Search for SQL Injection, 2nd issue
 * https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/demos/api-fuzzing-poc/-/pipelines/160958386/test_report

### Proposal

Review the scanner code that identifies binary vs. ascii payloads and correct the logic.

title: [Step 4] Include personal snippets in RootStorageStatistics
description:
At the moment, in the `RootStorageStatistics` class, we gather the snippet size from every snippet create in a project belonging to a namespace. Nevertheless, we need to include the personal snippet size when the namespace belongs to a user and not a group.

For that, we need to extend `RootStorageStatistics` and, when the namespace belongs to a user, the value inside `snippets_size` will be the sum of all project snippets associated to the namespace plus all the personal snippets of the namespace user.

filtered by the "regression" or "bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

The position of image threads started in MRs (Overview tab) seems to depend on the viewport size when the thread was created

| Viewport size when thread was created | Larger viewport size when viewing the same thread, even after page refresh |
| ------ | ------ |
| ![Viewport size when thread was created](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/fab02fca27067132e2aee2e149c44913/image.png) | ![GIF: Larger viewport size when viewing the same thread, even after page refresh](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/564ca3e7fb1254099f00c427fdf2ea6d/CleanShot_2020-05-21_at_13.58.56.gif) |

### Steps to reproduce
1. Leave a comment on an image in a MR
1. open the thread in different viewport sizes.

### Example Project

https://gitlab.com/andr3/meet.andr3.net/-/merge_requests/24/diffs#diff-content-f8aeeb2fcb79e3855b444ae85b432fe2b7dd2a7d

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Position changes with different viewport sizes.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Position is always consistent, regardless of viewport sizes.


### Possible fixes

This problem has been fixed in Design Management. Potentially reuse components or adopt the same implementation.

epic.title: Fix experience of using images in MRs

title: Image threads have inconsistent styling between MR and commits page
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Starting a thread on an image in an MR vs in a commit has inconsistent styling:

| MR | Commit |
| ------ | ------ |
| ![MR](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/32210ebe60ad4a67c847f5a477a5f7c7/image.png) | ![Commit](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/fd92025de61403eb1742e80b382d307d/CleanShot_2020-05-21_at_13.41.33.png) | 

### Steps to reproduce

Open an Image with a comment in an MR and Commit page to compare.

### Example Project

https://gitlab.com/andr3/meet.andr3.net/-/merge_requests/24/diffs#diff-content-f8aeeb2fcb79e3855b444ae85b432fe2b7dd2a7d

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Styling inconsistent.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Consistent styling. @pedroms to provide some guidance on which one should prevail.

title: Allow access to trials flow in local dev env
description: Currently developers can’t really access the trials flow (i.e. routes such as `/-/trials/new` render 404s) because of the use of `Gitlab.com?` as a control gate in a `before_action` callback. We should make use of `Gitlab.dev_env_or_com?` instead.
